title: Daily Evening Bhagavatam Discourse | HH Stoka Krishna Swami | SB 1.7.3-4 | 06-12-2021
speaker: HH Stoka Krishna Swami

segments.text: Om Agyana Timiraandhasya Gyananjanishalakaya
Chaksharanmelitam Yena Tasmait Shri Gurave Namaha
Nama Om Vishnupadaya Krishna Preshtaya Bhutale
Srimate Bhaktivedanta Swamin Nithinamine
Namaste Saraswate Deve Gauravani Pracharine
Nirvishesha Shunyavadi Pashchatya Deshatarine
Jaya Shri Krishna Chaitanya Prabhu Nithyananda
Shri Advaita Gadhadhara Shiva Sadhigaura Bhakta Vrinda
Hare Krishna Hare Krishna Krishna Krishna Hare Hare
Hare Rama Hare Rama Rama Rama Hare Hare
Om Namo Bhagavate Vasudevaya
Narayanam Namaskritya Naramchaiva Narottamam
Deveem Saraswateem Vyasam Tato Jayam Udi Rayet
In this session we will be discussing from the third verse
of the
seventh chapter of the first canto of Srimad Bhagavatam
Tasminsva Ashrame Vyaso Badari Shandamandite
Asino Apa Upasprishya Pranidhadyau Manaswayam
The meaning of this verse in that place Srila Vyasa Deva in his own ashram
which was surrounded by berry trees Badari Shandamandite
sat down to meditate
after touching water for purification
so in the purport
it is described
by Srila Prabhupada
under instructions of Srila
of his spiritual master Srila Narad Muni
Vyasa Deva concentrated his mind in that transcendental place of meditation
if you remember in the previous session we discussed about that place
Samyaprasa
where Vyasa Deva's Ashramam Prasadeva
place gave ashram was located on the western bank of
of the river Saraswati
and the place is the most suitable for spiritual activities
so there Vyasa Deva
sat down
for concentrating his mind
in meditation on the supreme Lord
Text number four
the fourth verse in the same chapter
seven chapter first canto of Bhagavatam
Bhakti Yogena Manasi
Samyak Pranihi
the meaning of this verse is thus he fixed his mind perfectly engaging it by linking it in
devotional service or bhakti yoga without any tinge of materialism and thus he saw the absolute
personality of Godhead along with his external energy which was under full control what did
Vyasadeva see or have vision of in the meditation he was able to see both the Supreme Lord Krishna
along with Krishna's external energy Maya which was under full control tadapashrayam under full
control so Srila Prabhupada has given a very
long introduction to this verse.
So Srila Prabhupada has given a very long introduction to this verse.
So Srila Prabhupada has given a very long introduction to this verse.
Perfect vision of the absolute truth is possible only by the linking process of
devotional service Yoga means a linking process right now our present condition
is we are forgetful of our relationship with the supreme of our link with the
Supreme Lord Krishna so to reestablish that forgotten relationship
or revive that lost connection is the process of yoga. Among the different
process of yoga, to have complete vision of the Absolute Truth as the Supreme
Personality of God, Krishna, is only possible by Bhakti. This is explained in
the Bhagavad Gita, Bhaktiamam Abhijanati. Only by Bhakti we can have vision of
Krishna or know Krishna or realize Krishna. There is no other process. This
also confirmed in the Bhagavad Gita. I just now said that. One can perfectly
realize the Absolute Truth only by the process of devotional service. And one
can enter into the kingdom of God by such perfect knowledge. This is what Bhagavad
Gita says. Bhaktiamam Abhijanati Yavanyas Chasmi Tatvatah. Tatomam Tatvatah
Vishatetad Anantaram. One can enter into the kingdom of God, kingdom of
Krishna, after perfectly getting knowledge about the Absolute Truth as the
Supreme Personality of God, Krishna. Imperfect realization of the Absolute by the
partial approach of impersonal Brahman or localized Paramatma does not permit
anyone to enter into the kingdom of God.
The Jnana process results in realization of the Absolute Truth as
impersonal Brahman. And the Ashtanga Yoga process results in realization of the
Absolute Truth as Paramatma, localized Paramatma, who is the expansion of the
Supreme Lord Krishna situated in the heart of every living being. But this
realization of the Absolute Truth as impersonal Brahman or localized
Paramatma does not permit a the transcendentalist to enter into the
kingdom of God. Shri Narada advised Vyasa Deva to become absorbed in
transcendental meditation on the personality of Godhead and his
activities. Specifically Narada instructed Vyasa Deva.
That the activities of the Supreme Lord, Haricharya, are completely
transcendental, enlivening to the Self and they can bring about complete
satisfaction of the Self while they can enlighten anyone about the Absolute
Truth as the Absolute Personality of Godhead, the highest realization of the
Absolute Truth.
So Srila Vyasa Deva did not take notice of the effulgence of Brahman. Because that
is not absolute vision.
The realization of the Absolute Truth as Bhagavan includes realization of the
Absolute Truth as Brahman and Paramatma. Bhagavan is complete realization.
Whereas Brahman or Paramatma is incomplete realization. This is explained in
beginning of the bhagavatam itself the absolute vision is the personality of
Godhead as is confirmed in the Bhagavad Gita Vasudeva Sarvamiti in the
Bhagavad Gita this is explained in the Upanishads also it is confirmed that
Vasudeva the personality of Godhead is covered by glowing golden glowing
Hiranmayena Patrena veil of impersonal Brahman in the Isha Upanishad it is
stated Hiranmayena Patrena satyasya Api hitam希 타 Syajnibayurapha
dē sister maya Krishnye alternates the Nairanbur-kirtan is removed by the mercy of
the Lord the real face of the absolute is seen just like if there is a person
and there is a very very very bright light in front of the person then we
cannot see every part of this little piece of attention that can be Рe denn equitaв
aus and there is a very very very bright light in front of the person then we
cannot see every part of this little piece of attention that can be
see that person because we'll be dazzled by the bright light. Similarly the
Supreme Lord Krishna his effulgence, personal effulgence is the Brahmajyoti
that Brahmajyoti doesn't enable anybody who is focused on the Brahmajyoti alone
to be able to see the Supreme Lord Krishna. The absolute is mentioned here
as Purusha or person, Apashyat Purusham Purnam, Purna Purusha the supreme or the
perfect or the complete personality. The absolute personality is mentioned in so
many Vedic literatures and in the Bhagavad Gita
the Purusha is confirmed as eternal original person. In 10th chapter it is
said very clearly it is described in the Bhagavad Gita. The absolute
personality of Godhead is the perfect person. Why is this being described in so
detail? It's because the subject of the Bhagavad Gita is the perfect person. Why is this being described in so detail? It's because the subject
matter of the Srimad Bhagavatam is Krishna the supreme personality of
Godhead who is the absolute personality, the absolute truth in the highest
realization or highest aspect of the absolute truth. The complete perfect
aspect of the absolute truth. Now that Supreme person Krishna has manifold
energies,
She has many, many, many varieties of energies, out of which the internal, external and marginal energies are specifically important.
Three categories of energies are very important.
The energy mentioned here is the external energy, as will be clear from the statements of her activities.
Energy is feminine.
The Supreme Lord is the only masculine personality.
Energy is feminine.
And how do we know that the energy is specifically the external energy?
By the statement of her activities that we described in the next few verses.
The internal energy is there along with the absolute person as moonlight is there with the moon.
Internal energy is always feminine.
This is the Supreme Lord.
The external energy is compared to darkness because it keeps the living entities in the darkness of ignorance.
The word apashrayam suggests that this energy of the Lord is under full control.
This maya is the external energy which is the cause of the living beings to be in the darkness of ignorance.

And when one realizes the Supreme Personality of Godhead, then one comes to the light of knowledge, spiritual knowledge, transcendental knowledge, the internal potency or superior energy is also called maya, but it is spiritual maya.
There are two kinds of maya or energies of the Supreme Lord.
The external energy is the inferior energy.
It is responsible for ignorance.
And the superior energy, the spiritual energy, yoga maya, is actually always of the characteristic of knowledge, spiritual knowledge, spiritual enlightenment.
This energy, internal energy or spiritual energy is exhibited.
In the absolute realm, in the spiritual world, when one is under the shelter of the internal potency, the darkness of ignorance, material ignorance is at once dissipated.
Just like when you are in a dark room, you come to light, immediately darkness is dispelled.
Light dispels darkness immediately.
There is no possibility of darkness when there is light.
Even those who are atma, rama or fixed in trance, take shelter of this maya, spiritual energy, internal energy.
So, devotional service or bhakti yoga is the function of the internal energy.
This is explained in the Bhagavad Gita.
Mahatma Anastumam Partha Daivim Prakritimashritaha Bhajanti Ananya Manaso Gyatva Bhutadim Avyayam
Ananya Manaso Bhajanti
They engage in devotional service under the influence of the internal energy or the divine energy of the Supreme Lord, which is a spiritual energy.
One under the shelter of the spiritual energy engages in devotional service.
Such internal energy is even superior to the spiritual bliss attainable in the conception of impersonal Brahman.
The impersonal Brahman is subordinate to the personality of Godhead.

Similarly, the bliss derived by realizing the impersonal Brahman is very insignificant compared to the ocean of transcendental bliss by realizing the personality of Godhead, Krishna, the absolute personality of Godhead, Krishna.
That is going to be elaborated in the Srimad Bhagavatam.
Srimad Bhagavatam.
Srimad Bhagavatam.
This is the main subject of the Bhagavatam, Krishna.
And realization of Krishna is realization of the unlimited transcendental bliss under the shelter of the spiritual potency of Krishna.
I will stop here.
Thank you very much.
Hare Krishna.
